The user "$username" has completed "$quizname" the quiz.
Points: $points Result: $result

userEmail.subject: Wp-Pro-Quiz: One user completed a quiz
userEmail.message:
Wp-Pro-Quiz
You have completed the quiz "$quizname".
Points: $points Result: $result

question.title: Question: 1
question.questionText: Which condition would be the least likely to be caused by failed or failing engine bearing?

question.title: Question: 2
question.questionText: At what point in an axial-flow turbojet engine will the highest gas pressures occur?

question.title: Question: 3
question.questionText: The fan rotational speed of a dual axial compressor forward fan engine is the same as the

question.title: Question: 4
question.questionText: The abbreviation “P” with subscript t7 used in turbine engine terminology means

answer.answerText: pressure and temperature at station No.7.
the total pressure at station No.7.

question.title: Question: 5
question.questionText: What turbine engine section provides for proper mixing of the fuel and air?

question.title: Question: 6
question.questionText: In a gas turbine engine, combustion occurs at a constant

question.title: Question: 7
question.questionText: Which statement is true regarding jet engines?

answer.answerText: At the lower engine speeds, thrust increases rapidly with small increases in RPM.
At the higher engine speeds, thrust increases rapidly with small increases in RPM.
The thrust delivered per pound of air consumed is less at high altitude than at low altitude.

question.title: Question: 8
question.questionText: Where is the highest gas pressure in a turbojet engine?

answer.answerText: At the outlet of the tailpipe section.
At the entrance of the turbine section.
In the entrance of the burner section.

question.title: Question: 9
question.questionText: What is the function of the stator vane assembly at the discharge end of a typical axial-flow compressor?

answer.answerText: To straighten airflow to eliminate turbulence.
To direct the flow of gases into the combustion chambers.
To increase air swirling motion into the combustion chambers.

question.title: Question: 10
question.questionText: The turbine section of a jet engine

answer.answerText: increases air velocity to generate thrust forces.
utilizes heat energy to expand and accelerate the incoming gas flow.

question.title: Question: 11
question.questionText: When starting a turbine engine,

answer.answerText: a hot start is indicated if the exhaust gas temperature exceeds specified limits.
an excessively lean mixture is likely to cause a hot start.
release the starter switch as soon as indication of light-off occurs.

question.title: Question: 12
question.questionText: In the dual axial-flow or twin spool compressor system, the first stage turbine dries the

question.title: Question: 13
question.questionText: During inspection, turbine engine components exposed to high temperatures may only be marked with such materials as allowed by the manufacturer. These materials generally include 1. layout dye. 2. commercial felt tip marker.3. wax or grease pencil.4. chalk.5. graphite lead pencil.

question.title: Question: 14
question.questionText: When starting a turbine engine, a hung start is indicated if the engine

answer.answerText: exhaust gas temperature exceeds specified limits.

question.title: Question: 15
question.questionText: What are the two basic elements of the turbine section in a turbine engine?

question.title: Question: 16
question.questionText: What are the two functional elements in a centrifugal compressor?

question.title: Question: 17
question.questionText: What is the first engine instrument indication of a successful start of a turbine engine?

answer.answerText: A rise in the engine fuel flow.
A rise in the exhaust gas temperature.

question.title: Question: 18
question.questionText: The basic gas turbine engine is divided into two main sections: the cold section and the hot section. (1) The cold section includes the engine inlet, compressor, and turbine sections. (2) The hot section includes the combustor, diffuser, and exhaust sections.

answer.answerText: neither No. 1 nor No. 2 is true.

question.title: Question: 19
question.questionText: Who establishes mandatory replacement times for critical components for turbine engines?

answer.answerText: The operator working in conjunction with the CAAV.

question.title: Question: 20
question.questionText: Main bearing oil seals used with turbine engines air usually what type(s)?

question.title: Question: 21
question.questionText: How does a dual axial-flow compressor improve the efficiency of turbojet engine?

answer.answerText: More turbine wheels can be used
Higher compression ratios can be obtained
The velocity of the air entering the combustion chamber is increased

question.title: Question: 22
question.questionText: An advantage of the axial-flow compressor is its

question.title: Question: 23
question.questionText: What is one purpose of the stator blades in the compressor section of a turbine engine?

answer.answerText: Stabilize the pressure of the airflow.
Control the direction of the airflow.
Increase the velocity of the airflow.

question.title: Question: 24
question.questionText: Where do stress rupture cracks usually appear on turbine blades?

answer.answerText: Across the blade root, parallel to the fir tree.
Along the leading edge, parallel to the edge.
Across the leading or trailing edge at a right angle to the edge length.

question.title: Question: 25
question.questionText: When the leading edge of a first-stage turbine blade is found to have stress rupture cracks, which of the following should be suspected?

question.title: Question: 26
question.questionText: Turbine blades are generally more susceptible to operating damage than compressor blades because of

answer.answerText: high pressure and high velocity gas flow.

question.title: Question: 27
question.questionText: Which of the following is the ultimate limiting factor of turbine engine operation?

question.title: Question: 28
question.questionText: Which of the following engine variables is the most critical during turbine engine operation?

question.title: Question: 29
question.questionText: Which turbine engine compressor offers the greatest advantages for both starting flexibility and improved high-altitude performance?

question.title: Question: 30
question.questionText: An advantage of the centrifugal-flow compressor is its high

question.title: Question: 31
question.questionText: Which two elements make up the axial-flow compressor assembly?

question.title: Question: 32
question.questionText: Standard sea level pressure is

question.title: Question: 33
question.questionText: Using standard atmospheric conditions, the standard sea level temperature is

question.title: Question: 34
question.questionText: When aircraft turbine blades are subjected to excessive heat stress, what type of failures would you expect?

question.title: Question: 35
question.questionText: In an axial-flow compressor, one purpose of the stator vanes at the discharge end of the compressor is to

answer.answerText: straighten the airflow and eliminate turbulence.
increase the velocity and prevent swirling and eddying.
decrease the velocity, prevent swirling, and decrease pressure.

question.title: Question: 36
question.questionText: Compressor field cleaning on turbine engines is performed primarily in order to

answer.answerText: prevent engine oil contamination and subsequent engine bearing wear or damage.
facilitate flight line inspection of engine inlet and compressor areas for defects or FOD
prevent engine performance degradation, increased fuel costs, and damage or corrosion to gas path surfaces.

question.title: Question: 37
question.questionText: Hot section inspections for many modern turbine engines are required

answer.answerText: only when an overtemperature or overspeed has occurred
on a time or cycle basic

question.title: Question: 38
question.questionText: In a dual axial-flow compressor, the first stage turbine drives

question.title: Question: 39
question.questionText: What should be done initially if a turbine engine catches fire when starting?

answer.answerText: Turn off the fuel and continue engine rotation with the starter.
Continue engine start rotation and discharge a fire extinguisher into the intake.
Continue starting attempt in order to blow out the fire.

question.title: Question: 40
question.questionText: What is the proper starting sequence for a turbojet engine?

question.title: Question: 41
question.questionText: In a turbine engine with a dual-spool compressor, the low speed compressor

answer.answerText: always turns at the same speed as the high speed compressor.
is connected directly to the high speed compressor.
seeks its own best operating speed

question.title: Question: 42
question.questionText: What is the function of the inlet guide vane assembly on an axial-flow compressor?

answer.answerText: Directs the air into the first stage rotor blades at the proper angle.
Converts velocity energy into pressure energy.
Converts pressure energy into velocity energy.

question.title: Question: 43
question.questionText: The stator vanes in an axial-flow compressor

answer.answerText: convert velocity energy into pressure energy.
convert pressure energy into velocity energy.
direct air into the first stage rotor vanes at the proper angle.

question.title: Question: 44
question.questionText: The velocity of subsonic air as it flows through a convergent nozzle

question.title: Question: 45
question.questionText: The velocity of supersonic air as it flows through a divergent nozzle

answer.answerText: is inversely proportional to the temperature.

question.title: Question: 46
question.questionText: The pressure of subsonic air as flows through a convergent nozzle

question.title: Question: 47
question.questionText: The pressure of supersonic air as it flows through a divergent nozzle

answer.answerText: is inversely proportional to the temperature.

question.title: Question: 48
question.questionText: Anti-icing of jet engine air inlets is commonly accomplished by

answer.answerText: electrical heating elements inside the inlet guide vanes.
engine bleed air ducted through the critical areas.
electrical heating elements located within the engine air inlet cowling.

question.title: Question: 49
question.questionText: Generally, when starting a turbine engine, the starter should be disengaged

answer.answerText: after the engine has reached self-accelerating speed
only after the engine has reached full idle RPM.
when the ignition and fuel system are activated

question.title: Question: 50
question.questionText: What is the primary advantage of an axial-flow compressor over a centrifugal compressor?

question.title: Question: 51
question.questionText: What is the major function of the turbine assembly in a turbojet engine?

answer.answerText: Directs the gages in the proper direction to the tailpipe.
Supplies the power to turn the compressor.
Increases the temperature of the exhaust gages.

question.title: Question: 52
question.questionText: What is the primary factor which controls the pressure ratio of an axial-flow compressor?

question.title: Question: 53
question.questionText: The non-rotating axial-flow compressor airfoils in an aircraft gas turbine engine are called

question.title: Question: 54
question.questionText: The air passing through the combustion chamber of a turbine engine is

answer.answerText: used to support combustion and to cool the engine.
entired combined with fuel and burned
speeded up and heated by the action of the turbines.

question.title: Question: 55
question.questionText: The compressor stators in a gas turbine engine act as diffusers to

answer.answerText: decrease the velocity of the gas flow.
increase the velocity of the gas flow.
increase the velocity and decrease the pressure of the gas.

question.title: Question: 56
question.questionText: Which of the following may be used to accomplish internal inspection of an assembled turbine engine?1- Infrared photography.2- Ultrasound 3- A borescope.4- Fluorescent penetrant and ultraviolet light.

question.title: Question: 57
question.questionText: What is the possible cause when a turbine engine indicates no change in power setting parameters, but oil temperature is high?

answer.answerText: Turbine damage and/or loss of turbine efficiency.

question.title: Question: 58
question.questionText: The compression ratio of an axial-flow compressor is function of the

question.title: Question: 59
question.questionText: Which of the following variables affect the inlet air density of turbine engine? 1. Speed of the aircraft./2. Compression ratio./3. Turbine inlet temperature./4. Altitude of the aircraft./5. Ambient temperature./6. Turbine and compressor efficiency.

question.title: Question: 60
question.questionText: In a jet engine which uses a fuel-oil heat exchanger, the oil temperature is controlled by a thermostatic valve that regulator the flow of

answer.answerText: both fuel and oil through the heat exchanger.

question.title: Question: 61
question.questionText: In an axial-flow turbine engine, compressor bleed air is sometimes used to aid in cooling the

question.title: Question: 62
question.questionText: Oil picks up the most heat from which of the following turbine engine components?

question.title: Question: 63
question.questionText: Which of the following is a function of the fuel-oil heat exchanger on a turbojet engine?

question.title: Question: 64
question.questionText: What would be the probable result if the oil system pressure relief valve should stick in the open position on a turbine engine?

question.title: Question: 65
question.questionText: What is the primary purpose of the oil-to-fuel heat exchanger?

question.title: Question: 66
question.questionText: What unit in an aircraft engine lubrication system is adjusted to maintain the desired system pressure?

question.title: Question: 67
question.questionText: Low oil pressure can be detrimental to the internal engine components. However, high oil pressure

answer.answerText: should be limited to the engine manufacture’s recommendations.
will not occur because of pressure losses around the bearings.

question.title: Question: 68
question.questionText: What is the primary purpose of the oil breather pressurization system that is used on turbine engines?

answer.answerText: Allows aeration of the oil for better lubrication because of the air/oil mist.
Provides a proper oil spray pattern from the main bearing oil jets.

question.title: Question: 69
question.questionText: The purpose of directing bleed air to the outer turbine case on some engines is to

answer.answerText: provide optimum turbine blade tip clearance by controlling thermal expansion.
provide up to 100 percent kinetic energy extraction from the flowing gases.
allow operation in a thermal environment 600 to 8000F above the temperature limits of turbine blade and vane alloys.

question.title: Question: 70
question.questionText: In order to relive excessive pump pressure in an engine’s internal oil system, most engines are equipped with a

question.title: Question: 71
question.questionText: From the following, identity the factor that has the least effect on the oil consumption of a specific engine.

question.title: Question: 72
question.questionText: Which of the following lubrication system components is never located between the pressure pump and the engine pressure system?

answer.answerText: Fuel line for oil dilution system.

question.title: Question: 73
question.questionText: The basic oil pressure relief valve setting for a newly overhauled engine is made

answer.answerText: within the first 30 seconds of engine operation.
when the oil is at a higher than normal temperature.

question.title: Question: 74
question.questionText: In which of the following situations will the oil cooler automatic bypass valve be open the greatest amount?

answer.answerText: Engine oil above normal operating temperature.
Engine oil below normal operating temperature.
Engine stopped with no oil flowing after run-up.

question.title: Question: 75
question.questionText: The vent line connecting the oil supply tank and the engine in some dry sump engine installations permits

answer.answerText: pressurization of the oil supply to prevent cavitations of the oil supply pump.
oil vapors from the engine to be condensed and drained into the oil supply tank.
the oil tank to be vented through the normal engine vent.

question.title: Question: 76
question.questionText: An engine lubrication system pressure relief valve is usually located between the

answer.answerText: oil cooler and the scavenger pump.
scavenger pump and the external oil system.
pump and the internal oil system.

question.title: Question: 77
question.questionText: The purpose of a relief valve installed in the tank venting system of a turbine engine oil tank is to

answer.answerText: prevent oil pump cavitations by maintaining a constant pressure on the oil pump inlet.
maintain internal tank air pressure at the ambient atmospheric level regardless of altitude or rate of change in altitude.
maintain a positive internal pressure in the oil tank after shutdown to prevent oil pump cavitations on engine start.

question.title: Question: 78
question.questionText: An oil tank having a capacity of 5 gallons must have an expansion space of

question.title: Question: 79
question.questionText: As a general rule, a small amount of small fuzzy particles or gray metallic paste on a turbine engine magnetic chip detector

answer.answerText: is considered to be the result of normal wear.

question.title: Question: 80
question.questionText: Why is expansion space required in an engine oil supply tank?

answer.answerText: For oil enlargement and collection of foam.

question.title: Question: 81
question.questionText: Which statement is correct regarding the ignition system of a turbine engine?

answer.answerText: The system is normally de-energized as soon as the engine starts.
It is energized during the starting and warm-up periods only.
The system generally includes a polar inductor-type magneto.

question.title: Question: 82
question.questionText: Why do turbine engine ignition systems require high energy?

answer.answerText: To ignite the fuel under conditions of high altitude and high temperatures.
Because the applied voltage is much greater.
To ignite the fuel under conditions of high altitude and low temperatures.

question.title: Question: 83
question.questionText: The primary advantage of pneumatic (air turbine) starters over comparable electric starters for turbine engines is

question.title: Question: 84
question.questionText: Inspection of pneumatic starters by maintenance technicians usually includes checking the

answer.answerText: oil level and magnetic drain plug condition.
stator and rotor blades for FOD

question.title: Question: 85
question.questionText: A safety feature usually employed in pneumatic starters that is used if the clutch does not release from the engine drive at the proper time during start is the

question.title: Question: 86
question.questionText: In the event a pneumatic start valve will not operate and the manual override must be used, the starter T-handle must be closed at scheduled starter drop out because

answer.answerText: the starter will overspeed at a given N2.
the starter oil will be blown overboard

question.title: Question: 87
question.questionText: What factor is not used in the operation of an aircraft gas turbine engine fuel control unit?

question.title: Question: 88
question.questionText: A supervisory electronic engine control (EEC) is a system that receives engine operating information and

answer.answerText: adjusts a standard hydromechanical fuel control unit to obtain the most effective engine operation.
develops the commands to various actuators to control engine parameters.
controls engine operation according to ambient temperature, pressure and humidity.

question.title: Question: 89
question.questionText: Generally, the practice when trimming an engine is to

answer.answerText: turn all accessory bleed air off.
turn all accessory bleed air on.
make adjustments (as necessary) for all engines on the same aircraft with accessory bleed air settings the same - either on or off.

question.title: Question: 90
question.questionText: Boost pumps in a fuel system

answer.answerText: are primarily used for fuel transfer.
provide a positive flow of fuel to the engine pump.

question.title: Question: 91
question.questionText: The fuel pump relief valve directs excess fuel to the

answer.answerText: inlet side of the fuel pump.
inlet side of the fuel strainer.

question.title: Question: 92
question.questionText: The primary condition(s) that allow(s) microorganisms to grow in the fuel in aircraft fuel tanks is (are)

answer.answerText: the presence of dirt or other particulate contaminants.

question.title: Question: 93
question.questionText: Where should the main fuel strainer be located in the aircraft fuel system?

answer.answerText: Downstream from the wobble pump check valve.
At the lowest point in the fuel system.
At any point in the system lower than the carburetor strainer.

question.title: Question: 94
question.questionText: Where physical separation of the fuel lines from electrical wiring or conduit is impracticable, locate the fuel line

answer.answerText: below the wiring and clamp the line securely to the airframe structure.
above the wiring and clamp the line securely to the airframe structure.
inboard of the wiring and clamp both securely to the airframe structure.

question.title: Question: 95
question.questionText: What is a characteristic of a centrifugal-type fuel boost pump?

answer.answerText: It separates air and vapor from the fuel.

question.title: Question: 96
question.questionText: Fuel boost pumps are operated

answer.answerText: to provide a positive flow of fuel to the engine.
primarily for fuel transfer to another tank.

question.title: Question: 97
question.questionText: Fuel pump relief valves designed to compensate for atmospheric pressure variations are known as

question.title: Question: 98
question.questionText: Fuel crossfeed systems are used in aircraft to

question.title: Question: 99
question.questionText: A fuel pressure relief valve is required on

question.title: Question: 100
question.questionText: 0. The component(s) in a turbine engine that operate(s) at the highest temperatures is/are the

answer.answerText: first stage turbine nozzle guide vanes.

question.title: Question: 101
question.questionText: 1.Which statement is true regarding the air passing through the combustion section of a jet engine?

answer.answerText: Most is used for engine cooling.
Most is used to support combustion.
A small percentage is frequently bled off at this point to be used for air-conditioning and/or other pneumatic powered systems.

question.title: Question: 102
question.questionText: 2.Why is high nickel chromium steel used in many exhaust system?

answer.answerText: Corrosion resistance and low expansion coefficient.
Corrosion resistance and high heat conductivity.

question.title: Question: 103
question.questionText: 3.Repair of exhaust system components

answer.answerText: is impossible because the material cannot be identified
must be accomplished by the component manufacturer.
is not recommended to be accomplished in the field

question.title: Question: 104
question.questionText: 4.How are combustion liner walls cooled in a gas turbine engine?

answer.answerText: By secondary air flowing through the combustion chamber.
By the pattern of holes and louvers cut in the diffuser section.
By bleed air vented from the engine air inlet.

question.title: Question: 105
question.questionText: 5. Most exhaust system failures result from thermal fatigue cracking in the areas of stress concentration. This condition is usually caused by

answer.answerText: the drastic temperature change which is encountered at altitude.
the high temperatures at which the exhaust system operates.

question.title: Question: 106
question.questionText: 6.Operating thrust reversers at low ground speeds can sometimes cause 1. sand or other foreign object ingestion./2. hot gas re-ingestion./3. compressor stalls.

question.title: Question: 107
question.questionText: 7.Engines using cold stream, or both cold and hot stream reversing include

question.title: Question: 108
question.questionText: 8.Turbojet and turbofan thrust reverser systems are generally powered by 1- fuel pressure./2- electricity./3- hydraulic pressure./4- pneumatic pressure./

question.title: Question: 109
question.questionText: 9.The rearward thrust capability of an engine with the thrust reverser system deployed is

answer.answerText: equal to or less than its forward capability, depending on ambient conditions and system design.

question.title: Question: 110
question.questionText: 0. Which statement is generally true regarding thrust reverser systems?

answer.answerText: It is possible to move some aircraft backward on the ground using reverse thrust.
Engine thrust reversers on the same aircraft usually will not operate independently of each other (must all be simultaneously).
Mechanical blockage system design permits a deployment position aft of the exhaust nozzle only.

question.title: Question: 111
question.questionText: 1.What is a function of the automatic propeller synchronizing system on multiengine aircraft?

answer.answerText: To control the tip speed of all propellers.
To control engine RPM and reduce vibration.
To control the power output of all engines.

question.title: Question: 112
question.questionText: 2.What operational force causes the greatest stress on a propeller?

question.title: Question: 113
question.questionText: 3. What operational force tends to increases propeller blade angle?

question.title: Question: 114
question.questionText: 4. How is a propeller controlled in a large aircraft with a turboprop installation?

answer.answerText: By varying the engine RPM except for feathering and reversing.

question.title: Question: 115
question.questionText: 5. How does the aerodynamic twisting force affect operating propeller blades?

answer.answerText: It tends to turn the blades to a high blade angle.
It tends to bend the blades forward
It tends to turn the blades to a low blade angle.

question.title: Question: 116
question.questionText: 6. Propellers exposed to salt spray should be flushed with

question.title: Question: 117
question.questionText: 7.How can a steel propeller hub be tested for cracks?
